answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your medical problems.  First get your blood pressure checked. This could be due to high blood pressure. The other possibility is clot in some blood vessel. This can also give out heat sensation without there being any temperature. Hyperthyroidism, diabetes, temporal arteritis are the other possibilities. It can also be an allergic reaction to some soap or oil etc. In females it could also be due to menopause or hormonal imbalance related to ovaries. Autoimmune conditions such as lupus and sjogren’s syndrome should also be ruled out.Since a confirmed diagnosis cannot be given on net please consult your doctor regarding this. Hope this helps. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I became ill suddenly in April after a sensation of my brain going cold lead to me having daily seizures and episodes of paralysis and being unable to speak. after several stays in hospital and much testing I keep being told all tests are within normal ranges.  Recently,along with other symptoms,  I have had two 'episodes' of feeling as though my face has suddenly become sunburned...my face actually goes red too and even once it subsides my skin feels tight and sore, just like actual sunburn.  Can anyone offer any explanation for this at all? Kindest regards,  Laurs.
title: Sunburn sensation
